name: Brandskyddsteamet AB
description: Redesigning a website for a successful sprinkler company
content: This project was done in the company Compentus, where I am currently employed. Together with a designer I developed a new website in Angular 5 for BST AB

name: Digital Hourglass
description: Increasing your study effectiveness by reminding you to take regular breaks
myContribution: Evenly distributed work. I contributed mostly to the programming part
content: The digital hourglass is exactly like it is named, a digital hourglass. But there is more to it than that! Not only does it keep track of your study time, it also reminds you when to take a break, and how long depending on your set timer. No longer do you need to use your phone that otherwise may be distracting.

name: Tetropica
description: Creating an automatic puzzle generator of solvable levels in a game
content: Tetropica is a puzzle game concept that challenges the player to solve levels of grid filled tiles using different sets of Tetris blocks. The game created within this project utilizes a level generator of solvable levels to be able to deliver a large range of challenges for the player to solve. The generator was constructed in modules and was responsible for both the creation of a level and to ensure that it was solvable. The solutions to the puzzles were made using a distance matrix and different block placement algorithms to both ensure that a solution was found and to find the best solution to any given level. The resulting work in this project a fully functional generator of solvable levels that for the most part generated levels with only a single solution.

name: Seniors vs. Snails
description: The killer snails are loose, and it's time to stop them once and for all!
myContribution: I was the lead developer in the project
content: Seniors vs. Snails is a crazy mobile action adventure game developed in Unity with Compentus.

name: ValuEye
description: A tool to visualize value data from WVS and development data from Gapminder in the course Information visualization
content: A tool to visualize value data from WVS and development data from Gapminder in the course Information visualization.

name: Le Bon Nobel
description: A visualization of the Nobel laureates in the course Information visualization
myContribution: My contribution can be seen under the tab 'individual contributions'
content: A visualization of the Nobel laureates in the course Information visualization. My contribution to the project can be seen in the about project page.

name: FastSL
description: The android app for you in a hurry!
myContribution: Evenly distributed project. I mainly worked on creating the model
content: FastSL is an android application created in 2017 that helps you to fast get information about nearby trains and buses. Here you can search for nearby stops, get line information and subscribe to a certain line to get update notifications from your phone. The project was made in Android studio and Java.

name: Perfect Steak Pan
description: This pan always cooks the perfect steak!
myContribution: Evenly distributed project. I made the interactive animation in Unity

images.caption: This is not an ordinary pan

content: The perfect steak pan always cooks the perfect steak due to it's highly advanced sensors that detect the height and width of the steak to adjust the heat accordingly. You then put on the VibratoRing that vibrates when the steak should be flipped. The result - the perfect steak, every time!

name: Pluggmotiveraren
description: A visual feedback rewarding application to help you study
myContribution: I made the Unity application and the visual animations
content: A Unity project made in the course Degree Project in Media Tchnonoly, First Cycle. In this project we wanted to investigate if students felt more motivated to study if they were using an interactive visual feedback application with gamified elements.

name: Aladin Adventures
description: An asymetrical virtual reality game experience made in Unity
myContribution: Evenly distributed project. I created the Unity application
content: An asymetrical game experience made in Unity in the course Multimodal Interactions and Interfaces. This game is meant to be played in a Virtual Reality headset using the controllers to steer. Spectators could also enter a website and send objects in different lanes in real time during the session.

name: ShapaSort Recycling
description: A game made in 48 hours in the game development contest Ludum Dare
content:
ShapaSort is a game about sorting, well trash...

The theme this Ludum Dare was shapeshifting and I decided to make a game where you shift the shape of trash to sort.

Link to submission

name: Lawyer Man
description: A game made in 48 hours in the game development contest Ludum Dare
content:
Lawyer Man is a speed typing action game where you flee from an angry mob of peasants and suing them if they get close. You have to match the paper with the color of their outfit and also type their name exactly correct for them to finally leave you. The theme this Ludum Dare was An unconventional weapon.

Link to submission

[HOW TO PLAY]
There are four different types of peasants following you. Red, blue, green and yellow. You have to give them paperwork in the matching color for them to be distracted and walk away. You get score for every distracted peasant.

When you see a peasant, select the matching paper(1,2,3,4) press open paper(Space) and write the peasant's name(upper/lowercase doesn't matter). Then go and give it to them. If the color and name matched the peasant will go away, if not, the peasant will rip the paper apart. You only have a limited number of papers, so be careful. More papers do however spawn around the map.

Move - W,A,S,D or ARROWS
Select paper - 1,2,3,4
Open paper - Space
Stamp(when you are done writing) - Enter
Cancel writing - Esc

name: Lignify
description: A social board game for interdisciplinary teams to work better together
myContribution: Evenly distributed project. I made the animation in Unity
content: This board game was created to help teams containing the three interdisciplinary areas of engineering, design and economy to understand each other better. With the use of this board game regularly within a project or at the start of a project the team hopefully will work better together after discovering how the three different areas might approach certain problems.

name: B.R.U.C.K
description: A horror game made in Unity
myContribution: I was the lead developer in the project
content:
What would you do if you wake up trapped in a moon base with an alien monster roaming around?

A hobby project that started in 2014 and continued to grow for a couple of years. Still an ongoing project with lots of ideas.
